column4: Can someone take a look at my smb.conf file and tell me why it isn't showing up in my view workgroup computers in win xp?
Can someone take a look at my smb.conf file and tell me why my ubuntu box  isn't showing up in my view workgroup computers in win xp?
ok.  hold on
ok bob2:  it is here http://nagual.homelinux.net/smb.conf
can you ping either of the box's?
Have you restarted samba since you edited your config?
also make sure you dont have any firewall software running on either machine
also, uncomment this line in the config name resolve order
still nothin.  Why would the 2 windows boxes be able to ping eachother, but not see eachother in the view workgroup computers?  I think if I could solve this problem I could fix the samba problem.
both of the windows boxes have file and printer sharing enabled.
yes
and have been rebooted since being added to that workgroup?
yes
hrm. wait a sec, do you have anything shared on the windows boxes?
no.  let me share something quick.  see if it helps
shouldn't there be some default widnows shares?
Yes, in windows you have to share something, otherwise nothing will show
didn't work.
open up My Computer, and goto Tools
then goto options
then goto View, scroll down and check the box for simple file sharing, then re-do the file share you just did.
its already checked
re check it, the only thing I can think of is the sharing info is messed up
and sadly theres no way to 'repair' windows the easy way
